segments.text: What's the matter , sir ? You look pale .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I feel dizzy and weak . And I'm having this pain in my ear . I think I am sick .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you often traveling by plane ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , this is the second time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's right . It's normal if you don't often take the plane . Just relax a little bit .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Why this happens to me when I am on the plane ? I feel bad .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Don't worry , sir . It's just because of the lower pressure .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What should I do about it ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You may feel much better if you chew some gum or peanuts .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: OK , thanks . Does it work really ? I'll give a try .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you feeling better now ? Do you need some pills ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Much better . Thank you . I just feel tired but I can't fall asleep .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: So , you'd better wear this eyeshade and you will sleep well .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I am not used to wearing that . Thanks .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: If you try to adapt yourself to your destination's local time , you'll feel more comfortable . So please try to sleep , and have meals according to Los Angeles's time .
segments.speaker: S1
